publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1295 Chris Ballance: Wigtown Book Town-That the Parliament congratulates the Wigtown Booktown Development Company and the booktraders of Wigtown on bringing the International Festival of Booktowns to Scotland from 21 to 23 May 2004; recognises that this is a prestigious international event being held in the United Kingdom for the first time, and commends Wigtown as an example of how an imaginative initiative based on re-use and recycling and small businesses can regenerate a town and help to raise the profile of a region. R
S2M-1295 Wigtown Book Town (lodged on 10 May 2004) Christine Grahame*, Donald Gorrie*, Dr Elaine Murray*

S2M-1295 Chris Ballance: Wigtown Book Town-That the Parliament congratulates the Wigtown Booktown Development Company and the booktraders of Wigtown on bringing the International Festival of Booktowns to Scotland from 21 to 23 May 2004; recognises that this is a prestigious international event being held in the United Kingdom for the first time, and commends Wigtown as an example of how an imaginative initiative based on re-use and recycling and small businesses can regenerate a town and help to raise the profile of a region. R Supported by: Christine Grahame, Donald Gorrie, Dr Elaine Murray
S2M-1295 Wigtown Book Town (lodged on 10 May 2004) John Swinburne*

S2M-1295 Wigtown Book Town (lodged on 10 May 2004) David Mundell*, Alex Fergusson*, Patrick Harvie*, Ms Sandra White*, Rob Gibson*, Nora Radcliffe*, Murdo Fraser*, Linda Fabiani*, Carolyn Leckie*, Mark Ballard*, Rosie Kane*, Eleanor Scott*, Bill Butler*, Shiona Baird*
S2M-1295 Wigtown Book Town (lodged on 10 May 2004) Mr Jamie Stone*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*
S2M-1295 Wigtown Book Town (lodged on 10 May 2004) Robin Harper*, Phil Gallie*
S2M-1295 Wigtown Book Town (lodged on 10 May 2004) Frances Curran*
S2M-1295 Wigtown Book Town (lodged on 10 May 2004) Dr Jean Turner*
